0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">Indicate 
by check mark if the registrant is submitting the Form 6-K in paper as permitted
by Regulations S-T Rule 101(b)(1): [&#160;&#160; &#160;].</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note</font>: Regulation S-T Rule 
101(b)(1) only permits the submission in paper of a Form 6-K if submitted solely
to provide an attached annual report to security holders.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">Indicate 
by check mark if the registrant is submitting the Form 6-K in paper as permitted
by Regulations S-T Rule 101(b)(7): [&#160;&#160; &#160;].</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Note</font>: Regulation S-T Rule 
101(b)(7) only permits the submission in paper of a Form 6-K if submitted to 
furnish a report or other document that the registrant foreign private issuer 
must furnish and make public under the laws of the jurisdiction in which the 
registrant is incorporated, domiciled or legally organized (the registrant's 
"home country"), or under the rules of the home country exchange on which the 
registrant's securities are traded, as long as the report or other document is 
not a press release, is not required to be and has not been distributed to the 
registrant's security holders, and, if discussing a material event, has already 
been the subject of a Form 6-K submission or other Commission filing on 
EDGAR.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',

Financial Statements of</div>
<div><br>
</div>

<div>&#160;</div>
<div><br>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-RIGHT: 18pt">NOTICE OF NO AUDITOR 
REVIEW OF CONDENSED</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; MARGIN-RIGHT: 18pt">CONSOLIDATED INTERIM 
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 22.5pt">The accompanying 
unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements of Almaden 
Minerals Ltd (&#8220;the Company&#8221;) for the six months ended June 30, 2016 
have been prepared by the management of the Company and approved by the 
Company&#8217;s Audit Committee and the Company&#8217;s Board of 
Directors.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 22.5pt">Under National 
Instrument 51-102, Part 4, subsection 4.3 (3) (a), if an auditor has not 
performed a review of the consolidated interim financial statements, they must 
be accompanied by a notice indicating that an auditor has not reviewed the 
financial statements.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 22.5pt">The accompanying 
unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements of the Company 
have been prepared by and are the responsibility of the Company&#8217;s 
management.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 22.5pt">The Company&#8217;s
independent auditor has not performed a review of these financial statements in 
accordance with standards established by CPA Canada for a review of the 
condensed consolidated interim financial statements by an entity&#8217;s 
auditor.</div>
<div><br>
</div>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">1. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-
block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Nature of Operations</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Almaden Minerals Ltd. (the 
&#8220;Company&#8221; or &#8220;Almaden&#8221;) was formed by amalgamation under
the laws of the Province of British Columbia, Canada on February 1, 2002.&#160; 
The Company is an exploration stage public company that is engaged directly in 
the exploration and development of exploration and evaluation properties in 
Canada and Mexico.&#160; The address of the Company&#8217;s registered office is
Suite 1710 &#8211;1177 West Hastings Street, Vancouver, BC, Canada V6E 
2L3.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company is in the business of exploring and 
developing mineral projects and its principal asset is the Ixtaca precious 
metals project located on its Tuligtic claim in Mexico.&#160; The Company has 
not yet determined whether this project has economically recoverable mineral 
reserves.&#160; The recoverability of amounts shown for mineral properties is 
dependent upon the establishment of a sufficient quantity of economically 
recoverable reserves, the ability of the Company to obtain the necessary 
financing or participation of joint venture partners to complete development of 
the properties and upon future profitable production or proceeds from the 
disposition of exploration and evaluation assets</font>.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">2.&#160; <font style="WIDTH: 
9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-
block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 
9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Basis of 
Presentation</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(a)</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px"
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY:
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Statement of Compliance with 
International Financial Reporting Standards (&#8220;IFRS&#8221;)</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements, including comparatives, have been prepared in accordance 
and compliance with International Accounting Standard <font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(&#8220;IAS&#8221;)</font> 34, Interim Financial Reporting as issued by 
the International Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;IASB&#8221;) and 
interpretations of the International Financial Reporting Interpretations 
Committee (&#8220;IFRIC&#8221;).</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(b)</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px"
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY:
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Basis of 
preparation</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries. 
This interim financial report does not include all of the information required 
of a full annual financial report and is intended to provide users with an 
update in relation to events and transactions that are significant to an 
understanding of the changes in financial position and performance of the 
Company since the end of the last annual reporting period.&#160; It is therefore
recommended that this financial report be read in conjunction with the annual 
audited financial statements of the Company for the year ended December 31, 
2015. However, this interim financial report provides selected significant 
disclosures that are required in the annual audited consolidated financial 
statements under IFRS.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certain amounts in prior periods have 
been reclassified to conform to the current period presentation.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements follow the same accounting policies and methods of 
application as the annual audited consolidated financial statements for the year
ended December 31, 2015, with the exception of the following new accounting 
standards and amendments which the Company adopted and are effective for the 
Company's interim and annual consolidated financial statements commencing 
January 1, 2016:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">IFRS 7: Amended to require additional 
disclosures on transition from IAS 39 and IFRS 9.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">7</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">2. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-
block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Basis of Presentation </font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; 
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(Continued)</font></font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: 
italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(b)</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px"
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY:
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Basis of preparation<font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>(continued)</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following new accounting standards and 
amendments are effective for future periods and have not been adopted by the 
Company:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><u>Revenue 
recognition</u></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">IFRS 15 - In May 2014, the IASB issued 
IFRS 15 &#8211; Revenue from Contracts with Customers ("IFRS 15") which 
supersedes IAS 11 &#8211; Construction Contracts; IAS 18 &#8211; Revenue; IFRIC 
13 &#8211; Customer Loyalty Programmes; IFRIC 15 &#8211; Agreements for the 
Construction of Real Estate; IFRIC 18 &#8211; Transfers of Assets from 
Customers; and SIC 31 &#8211; Revenue &#8211; Barter Transactions involving 
Advertising Services. IFRS 15 establishes a single five-step model framework for
determining the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows
arising from a contract with a customer. The standard is effective for annual 
periods beginning on or after January 1, 2017, with early adoption permitted. 
The Company is currently considering the impact, if any, of the standard on its 
future consolidated financial statements.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><u>Financial 
instruments</u></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">IFRS 9 - In July 2014, the IASB issued the
final version of IFRS 9 &#8211; Financial Instruments ("IFRS 9") to replace IAS 
39 &#8211; Financial Instruments: Recognition and Measurement. IFRS 9 provides a
revised model for recognition and measurement of financial instruments and a 
single, forward-looking 'expected loss' impairment model. IFRS 9 also includes a
substantially reformed approach to hedge accounting. The standard is effective 
for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018, with early adoption 
permitted. The Company is currently considering the impact, if any, of the final
standard on its future consolidated financial statements.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><u>Leases</u></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">IFRS 16 - In January 2016, the IASB issued
IFRS 16 &#8211; Leases ("IFRS 16") which replaces IAS 17 &#8211; Leases and its 
associated interpretative guidance. IFRS 16 applies a control model to the 
identification of leases, distinguishing between a lease and a service contract 
on the basis of whether the customer controls the asset being leased. For those 
assets determined to meet the definition of a lease, IFRS 16 introduces 
significant changes to the accounting by lessees, introducing a single, on-
balance sheet accounting model that is similar to current finance lease 
accounting, with limited exceptions for short-term leases or leases of low value
assets. Lessor accounting remains similar to current accounting practice. The 
standard is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2019, 
with early application permitted for entities that apply IFRS 15. The Company is
currently evaluating the impact the final standard is expected to have on its 
consolidated financial statements. The Company is currently considering the 
impact, if any, of the standard on its future consolidated financial 
statements.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">

normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">8</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">

<div><br>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements do not include all note disclosures required by IFRS for 
annual financial statements, and therefore should be read in conjunction with 
the annual financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; In 
the opinion of management, all adjustments considered necessary for fair 
presentation of the Company&#8217;s financial position, results of operations 
and cash flows have been included.&#160; Operating results for the three and six
month periods ended June 30, 2016 are not necessarily indicative of the results 
that may be expected for the year ending December 31, 2016.</div>

$159,689) included in exploration and evaluation assets as the value added tax 
relates to certain projects and will be recovered when the assets are sold (Note
7).</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">5. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-
block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Deposit on Mill Equipment</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On October 19, 2015, the Company entered 
into a Mill Purchase Option Agreement to acquire the Rock Creek mill.&#160; 
Pursuant to the agreement, Almaden has the exclusive right and option to 
purchase the mill for a total of US$6,500,000, subject to adjustment in certain 
circumstances (the &#8220;Option&#8221;).</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On November 25, 2015, the Company issued 
407,997 common shares at a fair value of $0.67 per share, for a total fair value
of $273,358.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In order to exercise the Option, Almaden 
must make option payments according to the following schedule:</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 50px">
<div>&#160;</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 350px">
<div>On execution of agreement:</div>
<div>On or before December 31, 2015:</div>
<div>On or before March 31, 2016:</div>
<div>On or before June 15, 2017:</div>
<div>On or before June 15, 2018:</div>

<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">31,833,551</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:
#ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" 
nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
</tr>
</table>
<div id="DSPFPageFooter"></div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following is a description of the 
Company&#8217;s most significant property interests and related spending 
commitments:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zec0a63f0978b4d2c99ba81a2c99a1c71" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(a)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY:
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Tuligtic</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In 2001, the Company acquired by staking a 
100% interest in the Tuligtic property in Puebla, Mexico. The property contains 
the Ixtaca Zone.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z1c3d62758bb64a07b8a36832db25c841" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(b)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Other</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company holds a 40% carried interest 
in the Logan property located in the Yukon Territory, Canada.&#160; The project 
is carried at a nominal value of $1.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

id="DSPFPageBreakArea">

Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">8.&#160;<font style="WIDTH: 
9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-
block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 
9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Share capital and 
reserves</font></div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z6e3a0ac00f3f4d22999454c63ff710e1" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(a)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Authorized share capital</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2016, the authorized share
capital comprised an unlimited number of common shares.&#160; The common shares 
do not have a par value.&#160; All issued shares are fully paid.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 25, 2016, the Company closed a non-
brokered private placement by the issuance of 3,229,082 units at a price of 
$1.35 per unit for gross proceeds to the Company of $4,359,260.&#160; Each unit 
consists of one common share and one-half of one non-transferable common share 
purchase warrant.&#160; Each whole warrant allows the holder to purchase one 
common share of the Company at a price of $2.00 per share until November 25, 
2018.&#160; A finder&#8217;s fee of $147,925 in cash and finders&#8217; warrants
to purchase up to 45,944 common shares at a price of $1.44 per common share 
until November 25, 2018 was paid on a portion of the placement.&#160; The fair 
value of the finders&#8217; warrants was $17,918.&#160; In connection with the 
private placement, the Company also incurred $119,689 in share issue 
costs.&#160; The proceeds of the private placement were allocated entirely to 
share capital.</div>
<div><br>
</div>

<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z18c03bf80a55429aab3870448168be9f" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>

<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><br>
</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">8. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; 
FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font

id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Share capital and

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zed72d35d25db47f08f4a144eb0b18ebc" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(c)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Share purchase option compensation plan</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s stock option plan 
permits the issuance of options up to a maximum of 10% of the Company&#8217;s 
issued share capital.&#160; Stock options issued to any consultant or person 
providing investor relations services cannot exceed 2% of the issued and 
outstanding common shares in any twelve month period.&#160; At June 30, 2016, 
the Company had reserved 578,227 stock options that may be granted.&#160; The
exercise price of any option cannot be less than the volume weighted average 
trading price of the shares for the five trading days immediately preceding the 
date of the grant.&#160; The maximum term of all options is five years.&#160; 
The Board of Directors determines the term of the option (to a maximum of five 
years) and the time during which any option may vest.&#160; Options granted to 
consultants or persons providing investor relations services shall vest in 
stages with no more than 25% of such option being exercisable in any three month
period.&#160; All options granted during the six months ended June 30, 2016 
vested on the grant date.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The continuity of stock options for the six 
months ended June 30, 2016 is as follows:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>

<div><br>

MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the three and six months ended 
June 30, 2016, the Company received $97,257 and $198,045 respectively (2015 - 
$Nil) from Almadex for administrative services fees included in other 
income.</div>
<div><br>
</div>

MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the three and six months ended 
June 30, 2016, the Company accrued $Nil and $38,816 respectively (2015 - $Nil 
and $134,308) payable to Almadex for drilling equipment rental services in 
Mexico.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">

<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY:

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the three and six months ended 
June 30, 2016, the Company employed a person related to the Chairman for a 
salary </font>of $8,450 and $16,900<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"> respectively less statutory deductions (three 
and six months ended June 30, 2015 - $10,400 and $20,800, respectively) for 
marketing and administrative services provided to the Company.</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">10</font><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">. <font style="WIDTH: 
9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-
block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font></font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">&#160;Net loss per share</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; TEXT-INDENT: -90.55pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 126pt; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">Basic and diluted net loss per share</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The calculation of basic net loss per 
share for the three months ended June 30, 2016 was based on the loss
attributable to common shareholders of $1,685,109 (June 30, 2015 - $668,763) and
a weighted average number of common shares outstanding of 79,492,551 (June 30, 
2015 &#8211; 72,122,686).</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The calculation of basic net loss per 
share for the six months ended June 30, 2016 was based on the loss attributable 
to common shareholders of $2,403,954 (June 30, 2015 - $2,804,425) and a weighted
average number of common shares outstanding of 78,777,768 (June 30, 2015 &#8211;
72,122,686).</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: -0.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The calculation of 
diluted net loss per share for the three and six month periods ended June 30, 
2016 and 2015 did not include the effect of stock options and warrants as they 
are anti-dilutive.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">12. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font

id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font>&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Commitments</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company has entered into an operating
lease for office premises through August 30, 2017.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On January 29, 2013, the Company entered 
into contracts with its Chairman and President for an annual remuneration of 
$240,000 and $265,000 respectively effective January 1, 2013, for two years, 
which was renew for two additional successive terms of 24 months.&#160; 
Effective December 31, 2015, the Chairman&#8217;s contract was mutually 
terminated and effective January 1, 2016, the Company and the Chairman entered 
into a new contract for an annual remuneration of $240,000 for two years, 
renewable for two additional successive terms of 24 months ending Dec 31, 
2021.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As at June 30, 2016, the remaining 
payments for the executive contract and the operating lease are due as 
follows:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">13. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font>&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Financial 
instruments</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The fair values of the Company&#8217;s 
cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable and trade and other payables 
approximate their carrying values because of the short-term nature of these 
instruments.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s financial instruments
are exposed to certain financial risks, including currency risk, credit risk, 
liquidity risk, interest rate risk and commodity and equity price risk.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z1ad6f573cdd94d0d802e128095516c96" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(a)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Currency risk</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s property interests in 
Mexico make it subject to foreign currency fluctuations and inflationary 
pressures which may adversely affect the Company&#8217;s financial position, 
results of operations and cash flows.&#160; The Company is affected by changes 
in exchange rates between the Canadian Dollar, the US dollar and Mexican 
peso.&#160; The Company does not invest in foreign currency contracts to 
mitigate the risks.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As at June 30, 2016, the Company is 
exposed to foreign exchange risk through the following assets and liabilities 
denominated in currencies other than the functional currency of the applicable 
subsidiary:</div>

#ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">$</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1,373</div>
</td>

id="DSPFPageBreakArea">

<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px;

</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New

<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">13. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font>&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Financial instruments 
</font>(Continued)</font></div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zed6460d1e4cd4e01ab812067c6805665" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(<font style="FONT-STYLE: normal">a)</font></td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Currency risk<font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal"> 
(continued)</font></td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A 10% change in the US dollar exchange 
rate relative to the Canadian dollar would change the Company&#8217;s net loss 
by $40,000.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A 10% change in the Mexican peso relative 
to the Canadian dollar would change the Company&#8217;s net loss by 
$32,000.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zf956d6f6c5ce48329c6824905a24518a" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(b)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Credit risk</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s cash and cash 
equivalents are held in large Canadian financial institutions.&#160; These 
investments mature at various dates during the twelve months following the 
statement of financial position date.&#160; The Company&#8217;s excise tax 
included in accounts receivables and prepaid expenses consists primarily of 
sales tax due from the federal government of Canada. The Company is exposed to 
credit risks through its accounts receivable.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">To mitigate exposure to credit risk on 
cash and cash equivalents, the Company has established policies to limit the 
concentration of credit risk with any given banking institution where the funds 
are held, to ensure counterparties demonstrate minimum acceptable credit risk 
worthiness and ensure liquidity of available funds.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As at June 30, 2016, the Company&#8217;s 
maximum exposure to credit risk is the carrying value of its cash and cash 
equivalents and accounts receivable.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="ze03009904a1e4845ace31664365ce1e5" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(c)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Liquidity risk</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Liquidity risk is the risk that the 
Company will not be able to meet its financial obligations as they fall 
due.&#160; The Company manages liquidity risk through the management of its 
capital structure.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Trade and other payables are due within 
twelve months of the statement of financial position date.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z601d4e8975b44328a4e6ade7e0674f2e" class="DSPFListTable"
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(d)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Interest rate risk</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Interest rate risk is the risk that the 
fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because
of changes in market interest rates. The Company is exposed to varying interest 
rates on cash and cash equivalents. The Company has no interest bearing 
debt.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A 1% change in the interest rate would 
change the Company&#8217;s net income by $60,000.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z3d4a1065eaf647c9ad9236d81ec0ba2a" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 35.45pt"></td>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: 36.55pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: 
right">(e)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: normal; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Commodity and equity price risk</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The ability of the Company to explore its 
exploration and evaluation assets and the future profitability of the Company 
are directly related to the market price of gold and other precious 
metals.&#160; The Company monitors gold prices to determine the appropriate 
course of action to be taken by the Company.&#160; Equity price risk is defined 
as the potential adverse impact on the Company&#8217;s performance due to 
movements in individual equity prices or general movements in the level of the 
stock market.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 70.9pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">17</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="z7ee1e30602404a64abed69813f14b523" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 14pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Almaden Minerals Ltd.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Notes to the condensed consolidated interim financial 
statements</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the three and six months ended June 30, 2016</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Unaudited - Expressed in Canadian 
dollars</div>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">14. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font>&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Management of 
capital</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company considers its capital to 
consist of components of equity.&#160; The Company&#8217;s objectives when 
managing capital are to safeguard the Company&#8217;s ability to continue as a 
going concern in order to pursue the exploration of its exploration and 
evaluation assets and to maintain a flexible capital structure which optimizes 
the costs of capital at an acceptable risk.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company manages the capital structure
and makes adjustments to it in light of changes in economic conditions and the 
risk characteristics of the underlying assets.&#160; To maintain or adjust the 
capital structure, the Company may attempt to issue new shares and, acquire or 
dispose of assets.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In order to maximize ongoing exploration 
efforts, the Company does not pay out dividends.&#160; The Company&#8217;s 
investment policy is to invest its short-term excess cash in highly liquid 
short-term interest-bearing investments with short term maturities, selected 
with regards to the expected timing of expenditures from continuing 
operations.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 35.45pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company expects its current capital 
resources will be sufficient to carry its exploration plans and operations for 
the foreseeable future.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">15. <font style="WIDTH: 9pt; 
DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="WIDTH: 9pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" 
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font>&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Segmented 
information</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company operates in one reportable 
operating segment, being the acquisition and exploration of mineral resource 
properties.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s non-current assets are 
located in the following geographic locations:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zcce40d4deb724f7c9230acc0375b8fe8" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

valign="bottom" colspan="2">

FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">June 30,</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">2016</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; VERTICAL-ALIGN: middle" 
valign="bottom" colspan="2">

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">December 31, </div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">2015</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 76%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top" 
valign="bottom">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Canada</div>
</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">$</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">1,335,651</div>
</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
valign="bottom">&#160;</td>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s revenues were all earned
in Canada primarily from interest income on corporate cash reserves and 
administrative services fees (Note 9(b)).</div>

<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">$</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">1,230,432</div>
</td>

New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Subsequent 
events</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company received $6,914,080 and $116,667
on the exercise of 4,376,000 and 116,667 warrants with an exercise price of 
$1.58 and $1.00 respectively.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In accordance with the Company&#8217;s stock
option plan, options holders exercised 105,000 stock options on a cashless basis
at an exercise price of $1.37.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div>

solid; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><a id="Exhibit99.2" 
name="Exhibit99.2"><!--Anchor--></a>Exhibit 99.2</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALMADEN MINERALS LTD.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">June 30, 2016</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">INTRODUCTION</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This Management's Discussion and Analysis ("MD&amp;A") for 
Almaden Minerals Ltd. ("Almaden" or the "Company") has been prepared based on 
information known to management as of August 8, 2016.&#160; This MD&amp;A is 
intended to help the reader understand the condensed consolidated interim 
audited financial statements of Almaden.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Management is responsible for the preparation and integrity of 
the condensed consolidated interim financial statements, including the 
maintenance of appropriate information systems, procedures and internal 
controls. Management also ensures that information used internally or disclosed 
externally, including the condensed consolidated interim financial statements 
and MD&amp;A, is complete and reliable.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company's board of directors follows recommended corporate-
governance guidelines for public companies to ensure transparency and 
accountability to shareholders.&#160; The board's audit committee meets with 
management regularly to review the condensed consolidated interim financial 
statements, including the MD&amp;A, and to discuss other financial, operating 
and internal-control matters.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All currency amounts are expressed in Canadian dollars unless 
otherwise noted.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This document may contain "forward-looking information" within 
the meaning of Canadian securities legislation and "forward-looking statements" 
within the meaning of the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act
of 1995 (collectively, "forward-looking statements").&#160; These forward-
looking statements are made as of the date of this document and the Company does
not intend, and does not assume any obligation, to update these forward-looking 
statements, except as required by law.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Forward-looking statements relate to future events or future 
performance and reflect Company management's expectations or beliefs regarding 
future events and include, but are not limited to, statements with respect to 
the estimation of mineral reserves and mineral resources, the realization of 
mineral reserve estimates, the timing and amount of estimated future production,
costs of production, capital expenditures, success of mining operations, 
environmental risks, unanticipated reclamation expenses, title disputes or 
claims and limitations on insurance coverage.&#160; In certain cases, forward-
looking statements can be identified by the use of words such as "plans", 
"expects" or "does not expect", "is expected", "budget", "scheduled", 
"estimates", "forecasts", "intends", "anticipates" or "does not anticipate", or 
"believes", or variations of such words and phrases or statements that certain 
actions, events or results "may", "could", "would", "might" or "will be taken", 
"occur" or "be achieved" or the negative of these terms or comparable 
terminology.&#160; By their very nature forward-looking statements involve known
and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors which may cause the actual 
results, performance or achievements of the Company to be materially different 
from any future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by the
forward-looking statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">

normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-

WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Such factors include, among others, risks related to actual 
results of current exploration activities; changes in project parameters as 
plans continue to be refined; future prices of mineral resources; possible 
variations in ore reserves, grade or recovery rates; accidents, labour disputes 
and other risks of the mining industry; delays in obtaining governmental 
approvals or financing or in the completion of development or construction 
activities.&#160; Although the Company has attempted to identify important 
factors that could cause actual actions, events or results to differ materially 
from those described in forward-looking statements, there may be other factors 
that cause actions, events or results not to be as anticipated, estimated or 
intended.&#160; There can be no assurance that forward-looking statements will 
prove to be accurate, as actual results and future events could differ 
materially from those anticipated in such statements. Accordingly, readers 
should not place undue reliance on forward-looking statements.</div>
<div><br>
</div>

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following forward looking statements have been made in this
MD&amp;A.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ADDITIONAL INFORMATION</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Financial statements, MD&amp;A's and additional information 
relevant to the Company and the Company's activities can be found on SEDAR at 
<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">www.sedar.com</font>, on the EDGAR section of the United States Securities
and Exchange Commission's website at <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">www.sec.gov</font>, and/or on the 
Company's website at<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #0000ff; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><u>&#160;</u></font><font style="BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><u>www.almadenminerals.com</u></font>.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">HIGHLIGHTS</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the quarter ended June 30, 2016, all of the Company's 
efforts were focused on the Ixtaca gold/silver project in Puebla State, 
Mexico.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Technical Work</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the quarter, Almaden filed an amended NI 43-101 
Technical Report titled "Preliminary Economic Assessment of the Ixtaca Project",
which provides further detail to its December 9, 2015 press release summarizing 
the results of integrating the Rock Creek Mill and a smaller, higher grade, 
payback focused pit on potential mine economics.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 25, 2016, the Company announced that it had raised $4.4 
million by way of a non-brokered private placement.&#160; The private placement 
involved the issuance of 3,229,082 units ("Units") at $1.35 per Unit.&#160; Each
Unit consisted of one common share and one-half of one non-transferable common 
share purchase warrant (each such whole share purchase warrant, a 
"Warrant").&#160; Each Warrant allows the holder to purchase one common share of
the Company at a price of $2.00 per share until November 25, 2018.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On June 13, 2016, Almaden updated shareholders on progress 
towards producing a pre-feasibility study at Ixtaca, and provided an overview of
the exploration drilling plans at the Tuligtic property.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">2</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Community 
Programs</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company remained actively engaged in the local communities,
continuing the outreach through its permanent community office in Santa Maria 
and its mobile information module. In addition, as part of its efforts to 
educate local people about the mining industry, as at the date of this report 
the Company had taken a total of approximately 380 people on nineteen separate 
mine tours.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">OUTLOOK</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Almaden has sufficient cash on hand to conduct its development 
plans for the next fiscal year at Ixtaca.&#160; The updated National Instrument 
(NI) 43-101 Mineral Resource Estimate on the Ixtaca Zone released January 22, 
2014 and the Amended PEA Report dated April 13, 2016 will now be the starting 
point for on-going engineering studies aimed to result in a Pre-Feasibility 
Study ("PFS").</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Advanced engineering studies will be the emphasis of this 
year's work program, as well as preparations necessary to advance permitting 
activities for the Ixtaca project.&#160; The Company is also conducting an 
exploration drill program to test for additional high grade vein structures 
immediately adjacent to known mineralisation and the Amended PEA pit.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Background</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Almaden is an exploration stage company engaged in the 
exploration and development of the Ixtaca Gold/Silver mineral property in 
Mexico.&#160; The Company's common stock is quoted on the NYSE MKT under the 
trading symbol AAU and on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol AMM.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Overview</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Company Mission and Focus</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Almaden is focused on advancing its Ixtaca gold/silver deposit,
located in Puebla State, Mexico, through advanced engineering studies.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Qualified Person</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Morgan Poliquin, P.Eng., a qualified person under the meaning 
of National Instrument 43-101 ("NI 43-101") and the President, Chief Executive 
Officer and Director of Almaden, has reviewed and approved the technical 
contents in this MD&amp;A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">3</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Use of the terms "Mineral Resources" and 
"Mineral Reserves"</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any reference in this 
MD&amp;A to Mineral Resources does not mean Mineral Reserves.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Under NI 43-101, a Mineral Reserve is the economically mineable
part of a Measured or Indicated Mineral Resource demonstrated by at least a 
Preliminary Feasibility Study.&#160; This Study must include adequate 
information on mining, processing, metallurgical, economic and other relevant 
factors that demonstrate, at the time of reporting, that economic extraction can
be justified.&#160; A Mineral Reserve includes diluting materials and allowances
for losses that may occur when the material is mined.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mineral Resources are sub-divided, in order of increasing 
geologic confidence, into Inferred, Indicated and Measured categories.&#160; An 
Inferred Mineral Resource has a lower level of confidence than that applied to 
an Indicated Mineral Resource. An Indicated Mineral Resource has a higher level 
of confidence than an Inferred Mineral Resource but has a lower level of 
confidence than a Measured Mineral Resource.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The terms "Mineral Reserve," "Proven Mineral Reserve" and
"Probable Mineral Reserve" are Canadian mining terms as defined in accordance 
with NI 43-101 and the CIM Standards.&#160; These definitions differ from the 
definitions in SEC Industry Guide 7 under the U.S. Securities Act.&#160; Under 
SEC Industry Guide 7, a reserve is defined as part of a mineral deposit which 
could be economically and legally extracted or produced at the time the reserve 
determination is made.&#160; Under SEC Industry Guide 7&#160;standards, a 
"final" or "bankable" feasibility study is required to report reserves, the 
three-year historical average price is used in any reserve or cash flow analysis
to designate reserves and the primary environmental analysis or report must be 
filed with the appropriate governmental authority. In addition, the terms 
"Mineral Resource," "Measured Mineral Resource," "Indicated Mineral Resource" 
and "Inferred Mineral Resource" are defined in and required to be disclosed by 
NI&#160;43-101; however, these terms are not defined terms under SEC Industry 
Guide 7 and are normally not permitted to be used in reports and registration 
statements filed with the SEC.&#160; Investors are cautioned not to assume that 
any part or all of mineral deposits in these categories will ever be converted 
into reserves.&#160; "Indicated Mineral Resource" and "Inferred Mineral 
Resource" have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence, and great 
uncertainty as to their economic and legal feasibility.&#160; It cannot be 
assumed that all, or any part, of an Indicated Mineral Resource or Inferred 
Mineral Resource will ever be upgraded to a higher category.&#160; Under 
Canadian rules, estimates of Inferred Mineral Resources may not form the basis 
of feasibility or pre-feasibility studies, except in rare cases.&#160; Investors
are cautioned not to assume that all or any part of an Inferred Mineral Resource
exists or is economically or legally mineable.&#160; Disclosure of "contained 
ounces" in a resource is permitted disclosure under Canadian regulations; 
however, the SEC normally only permits issuers to report mineralization that 
does not constitute "reserves" by SEC standards as in place tonnage and grade 
without reference to unit&#160;measures.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Accordingly, information contained in this MD&amp;A filed 
herewith or incorporated by reference herein contain descriptions of our mineral
deposits that may not be comparable to similar information made public by 
U.S.&#160;companies subject to the reporting and disclosure requirements under 
United States federal securities laws and the rules&#160;and regulations 
promulgated thereunder.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">4</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-WEIGHT: normal"><u style="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1px solid">CAUTIONARY NOTE TO U.S.
INVESTORS REGARDING MINERAL RESOURCE AND <br>
MINERAL RESERVE ESTIMATES</u></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Cautionary Note 
&#8211; The United States Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") permits 
U.S. mining companies, in their filings with the SEC, to disclose only those 
mineral deposits that a company can economically and legally extract or 
produce.&#160; Almaden Minerals Ltd. uses certain terms such as "measured", 
"indicated", "inferred", and "mineral resources," which the SEC guidelines 
strictly prohibit U.S. registered companies from including in their filings with
the SEC.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Mineral 
Properties</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following is a brief description of the principal mineral 
property owned by the Company.&#160; Additional information can be obtained from
Almaden's website <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">www.almadenminerals.com</font>.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Ixtaca (Tuligtic) &#8211; Mexico</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">100% owned, subject 
to 2% NSR royalty held by Almadex Minerals Limited</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Location and 
Ownership</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The property lies within the Trans Mexican 
Volcanic Belt about 120 kilometres southeast of the Pachuca gold/silver deposit 
which has reported historic production of 1.4 billion ounces of silver and 7 
million ounces of gold.&#160; The Tuligtic property,</font> located in Puebla 
State, <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: 
#000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">was acquired by staking in 2001 following prospecting 
work carried out by the Company in the area.&#160; Since that time, Almaden has 
had agreements to develop the property with three separate parties, all of whom 
relinquished all rights to the property and none of whom conducted work on the 
Ixtaca zone.&#160; The Ixtaca zone is located along a trend of shallowly eroded 
epithermal systems that Almaden has identified in eastern Mexico.</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Recent Updates</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Amended Preliminary 
Economic Assessment</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
normal">On January 22, 2016, Almaden filed a NI 43-101 Technical Report titled 
"Preliminary Economic Assessment of the Ixtaca Project", which provides further 
detail to its December 9, 2015 press release summarizing the results of 
integrating the Rock Creek Mill and a smaller, higher grade, payback focused pit
on potential mine economics. Almaden subsequently filed an amended technical 
report on SEDAR on April 13, 2016 (the "Amended PEA"), however the amendments 
were not material changes and the Report's data, inputs, interpretation, 
conclusions and results all remain unchanged.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
normal">The Amended PEA follows the historical PEAs released in 2014 and 2015 
("Historical PEAs") which evaluated larger throughput development 
alternatives.&#160; The primary reasons for providing an update to the 
Historical PEAs were to show the impact of significantly reduced initial capital
cost on project economics and, given the significant decrease in precious metals
prices, to demonstrate the viability of a mine plan which focuses on the near 
surface high grade limestone hosted portions of the Ixtaca Zone deposit.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
normal">This mine plan is a smaller high grade scenario that still allows for 
expansion into a larger production scenario similar to those described in 
Almaden's Historical PEA studies.&#160; In addition, the Amended PEA 
incorporates the optioned Rock Creek mill as well as results from various 
engineering studies related to the project which had been conducted since the 
Historical PEAs were completed. The Amended PEA incorporates:</div>

id="DSPFPageBreakArea">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 12pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt">
